body.p: Other respondents suggested that the separability criterion should be modified to require recognition of an intangible asset separately from goodwill only if management of the entity intends to sell, lease or otherwise exchange the asset. The FASB rejected that suggestion because it concluded that the asset’s capability of being separated from the entity and exchanged for something else of value is the pertinent characteristic of an intangible asset that distinguishes it from goodwill. In contrast, management’s intentions are not a characteristic of an asset.
